Package com.rds_software.customers.menarini.projects.odp.backend

Backend layer for the ODP (Ordine di Pagamento) system.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    OdpUtils
    Utility class providing business logic validation for ODP (Ordine di Pagamento) operations.

Package com.rds_software.customers.menarini.projects.odp.backend Description

Backend layer for the ODP (Ordine di Pagamento) system.

Overview

This package contains the backend business logic and data access components for the ODP payment order management system. It provides a clean separation between the presentation layer (frontend) and data persistence.

Architecture

 +--------------------------------------+
 |  Frontend (UI Layer)                 |
 +--------------+-----------------------+
                |
                v
 +--------------------------------------+
 |  Services (Business Logic)           |
 |  - IOdpService                       |
 |  - Validation & Authorization        |
 |  - Role-based security               |
 +--------------+-----------------------+
                |
                v
 +--------------------------------------+
 |  Repositories (Data Access)          |
 |  - IOdpRepository                    |
 |  - CSV/RDBMS implementations         |
 +--------------------------------------+

Subpackages

services

Business logic layer that:

  • Enforces business rules and validation
  • Implements role-based authorization
  • Manages ODP lifecycle and state transitions
  • Provides high-level operations for the frontend

Key classes:

  • IOdpService - Main service interface
  • OdpService - Default implementation
  • IOdpServiceFactory - Factory for creating service instances

repos

Data access layer that:

  • Abstracts data storage and retrieval
  • Supports multiple repository implementations (CSV, RDBMS)
  • Handles CRUD operations
  • Manages authorization flow persistence

Key classes:

  • IOdpRepository - Repository interface
  • CsvOdpRepository - CSV file-based implementation

Utility Classes

  • OdpUtils - Utility methods for ODP operations, permission checks, and state transitions

Design Principles

Separation of Concerns

The backend is structured in layers:

  • Service Layer - Business logic, validation, authorization
  • Repository Layer - Data access and persistence
  • Utilities - Shared helper functions

Dependency Inversion

Both service and repository layers are defined as interfaces, allowing for:

  • Multiple implementations (CSV, RDBMS, etc.)
  • Easy testing with mock implementations
  • Runtime selection of implementation

Security by Design

Authorization is enforced at the service layer:

  • All operations require a user ID
  • Role-based permissions are checked before executing operations
  • State-based edit restrictions are validated
  • Password validation required for approval operations

Usage Example

Service Layer Usage


 // Create service
 IOdpService service = IOdpServiceFactory.createOdpService("/path/to/csv");

 // Create an ODP (PROPOSER role required)
 Odp odp = new Odp();
 odp.setAzienda(company);
 // ... set other fields
 String odpId = service.createOdp(odp, "proposerUserId");

 // Submit for approval (PROPOSER role, must be owner)
 service.submitOdpForApproval(odpId, "proposerUserId");

 // Approve (SIGNER_1 role required)
 OdpAuthorizationStep step = new OdpAuthorizationStep();
 step.setUser(signerUser);
 step.setApproved(true);
 boolean approved = service.approveOdp(odpId, "password", step);

 // Search ODPs
 OdpSearchCriteria criteria = new OdpSearchCriteria();
 criteria.setOwnerUserId("proposerUserId");
 List<Odp> results = service.searchOdps(criteria, null, 0, 50);

Direct Repository Usage (Advanced)


 // Typically used internally by service layer
 IOdpRepository repo = service.getIOdpRepository();

 // Lower-level operations without business logic/security
 Odp odp = repo.findOdpById("ODP-001");
 List<OdpCompany> companies = repo.retrieveCompanies();
Version:
3.0
Author:
RDS Software
